TopicTitle: [Tutorial] How to Space... With a Wing!

Articles.Content:
This is, quite possibly, the most bizarre glitch that I've ever found.

It works off of the infiniglider principle, time-warp, and the odd properties of Launch Stability Enhancers!

...and now, you can build one for yourself.

Enjoy and let me know what you think!

[EDIT: I've heard that some people want a text tutorial on how to do stuff. Here goes.]

Start off with a RC-001S small remote guidance unit. Add a small stack decoupler and a cubic octagonal strut. Then, add on a Delta-Deluxe winglet to the strut, rotating it with the "W" and the "E" key twice. "Wee!" Stick a Launch Stability Enhancer on the back and you're good to go.

For better performance, use the Alt+F12 debug menu to enable part clipping and then make a horizontal line of struts. The longer, the better (as a whole).

Hope this helped!

Does anyone know how the Launch Stability Enhancer got ripped out of the ground on the second launch?! I'm not sure how that worked.

Edited April 29, 2014 by UpsilonAerospace

Ah the infiniglide concept. Weirdness ensues. I took this principle to another level with

although I didn't increase the physics speed so I'm not sure what it would have done if I had done that.

Nice video BTW. Do more!
